title: How to Edit Signature Options in Microsoft Outlook

steps.title: Open Outlook.
steps.content: Open Outlook. Go to https://www.outlook.com/ in your preferred web browser. This will open your Outlook inbox if you're already signed into Outlook. If you aren't signed into Outlook, enter your Microsoft email address (or phone number) and password to log in.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . This gear-shaped icon is in the upper-right side of your Outlook inbox. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . It's at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Email signature.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Email signature . This option is in the Layout section of the options on the left-hand side of the page. You may first have to click Layout to expand it in order to view the Email signature option.

steps.title: Add a picture to your signature.
steps.content: Add a picture to your signature. Click the picture icon in the top-left corner of the signature box, then select a picture and click Open . This will place a photo in your signature. Use this feature sparingly, since too large of a photo can detract from the signature itself.

steps.title: Format your signature.
steps.content: Format your signature. You can make parts of your signature bold , italic , or underlined by selecting the section you want to edit and then clicking the B , I , or underlined U icon, respectively. These icons are at the top of the signature box.

steps.title: Change your signature's font.
steps.content: Change your signature's font. Select the part of your signature that you want to change, then click AA at the top of the signature box and select a new font.

steps.title: Increase or decrease your signature's size.
steps.content: Increase or decrease your signature's size. Select the portion of the signature that you want to change, then click the A ▼ icon at the top of the signature box and select a number. The smaller the number is, the smaller the text will be.

steps.title: Use a different color for parts of your signature.
steps.content: Use a different color for parts of your signature. Select the part of your signature that you want to edit, click the A with a red bar below it, and click a color you want to use. This is a good way to call a reader's attention to a detail of your signature, such as your website or your phone number.

steps.title: Review other editing options.
steps.content: Review other editing options. Click in the top-right corner of the signature box, then look at the various options here. You can do things like change your signature's indentation, add superscript, clear all formatting, and insert a table from here.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the top-left corner of the Email Signature section. This will save your edited signature.

steps.title: Open Outlook.
steps.content: Open Outlook. This app is blue with a white envelope and a blue "O" on it. Tapping it will open your Outlook inbox if you're already signed in. If you aren't signed into Outlook, enter your Microsoft email address (or phone number) and password to log in.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in the upper-left corner of the screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings .
steps.content: Tap Settings . You'll find this gear-shaped icon in the bottom-left corner of the screen. This will open the Outlook Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Signature.
steps.content: Tap Signature . It's in the middle of the Settings page. Your current signature will open.

steps.title: Edit your current signature.
steps.content: Edit your current signature. In the Outlook mobile app, you can only edit the signature's content itself, not its formatting or imagery. Tap the signature, then edit or replace it.

steps.title: Tap < (iPhone) or (Android).
steps.content: Tap < (iPhone) or (Android). It's in the top-left corner of the screen. Doing so will save your edits to your old signature.

steps.title: Open Outlook 2016.
steps.content: Open Outlook 2016. This program resembles a blue and white envelope with a white "O" on it. Doing so opens the Outlook program.

steps.title: Click New Email.
steps.content: Click New Email . It's on the far-left side of the Home toolbar.

steps.title: Click Signature.
steps.content: Click Signature . This drop-down box is in the "Include" group of options in the Message toolbar.

steps.title: Click Signatures.
steps.content: Click Signatures . It's in the Signature drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click your name.
steps.content: Click your name. It's in the "Select signature to edit" box that's in the top-right corner of the Signatures and Stationery window.

steps.title: Change your signature's font.
steps.content: Change your signature's font. Select the part of the signature that you want to change, then click the font drop-down box and click a new font. The font drop-down box is above the top-left corner of the "Edit signature" box.

steps.title: Increase or decrease your signature's size.
steps.content: Increase or decrease your signature's size. Select the portion of the signature that you want to change, then click the numbered box to the right of the font box and click a number. The larger the number, the larger the selected text. A common use for this feature is enlarging one's name while keeping one's company title or website information small and on a line below the name.

steps.title: Format your signature.
steps.content: Format your signature. You can make parts of your signature bold, italic, or underlined by selecting the section you want to edit and then clicking the B , I , or underlined U icon, respectively. You'll find these icons to the right of the font and text size options.

steps.title: Apply a different color to your signature.
steps.content: Apply a different color to your signature. Select a piece of your signature, click the "Automatic" drop-down box to the right of the formatting options, then click a color you want to use. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Change your signature's indentation.
steps.content: Change your signature's indentation. Select your whole signature, then click one of the horizontal line icons to the right of the text color option. This will change the signature's margin.

steps.title: Add a link to your signature.
steps.content: Add a link to your signature. Click the link icon, which is on the far-right side of the editing options that are above the "Edit signature" window, and then type in the word you want to use as the link text as well as the link itself. You can also add a picture to your signature by clicking the icon to the left of the link icon and then selecting a photo.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . It's at the bottom of the window. Doing so saves your signature and applies the changes to any emails you send in the future.
